intro: Onosma mahabadensis, commonly known as the Mahabad onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Onosma mahabadensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
